intro: Deinbollia pervillei subsp. suarezensis, commonly known as the Suarez's starling tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar, characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and its flowers are typically pink or purple. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
